metadata.title: CVE-2018-17237 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A SIGFPE signal is raised in the function H5D__chunk_set_info_real() ofH5Dchunk.c in the HDF HDF5 1.10.3 library during an attempted parse of acrafted HDF file, because of incorrect protection against division by zero.This issue is different from CVE-2018-11207.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
hdf5-tools - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-cpp-11 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-mpich-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-openmpi-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2').
